# Count Min Sketch

Helpful in finding the frequency of items in a stream of data.  In the following example we will take a look at estimating the frequency of the top 10 tweeters in streaming application. 

Pushing the distribution calculation of a single window to a timeseries data structure in DSE we can discover frequency across any time range.

Count Min Sketch

Helpful in finding the frequency of items in a stream of data. In the following example we will take a look at estimating the frequency of the top 10 tweeters in streaming application.

Pushing the distribution calculation of a single window to a timeseries data structure in DSE we can discover frequency across any time range.

paragraphs.title: Add Spark Dependencies
Create Keyspace
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE KEYSPACE IF NOT EXISTS approximations WITH REPLICATION = { 'class' : 'SimpleStrategy', 'replication_factor' : 1 };

paragraphs.title: Create Table For Timeseries
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE TABLE  IF NOT EXISTS approximations.cmsdata ( id text, date text, batchtime timestamp, cmsstore blob, PRIMARY KEY ((id, date), batchtime));

paragraphs.title: Create Search Index on Timeseries
paragraphs.text:
%cassandra

CREATE SEARCH INDEX IF NOT EXISTS ON approximations.cmsdata WITH COLUMNS batchtime;

paragraphs.title: Process Stream and Perform CMS on each Window
Perform CMS on Larger Time Window
paragraphs.text:
%spark

import com.twitter.algebird._
import com.twitter.algebird.CMSHasherImplicits._
import com.twitter.chill.ScalaKryoInstantiator

import com.datastax.spark.connector.streaming._
import com.datastax.spark.connector._
import com.datastax.spark.connector.SomeColumns
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat
import java.util.Date


// K highest frequency elements to take
val TOPK = 10

val todayAsString = new SimpleDateFormat("MM-dd-yyyy").format(new Date())
    
val rdd  = sc.cassandraTable[Array[Byte]]("approximations", "cmsdata").select("cmsstore").where("id = ?", "tophashtags").where("date = ?", todayAsString)

val approxUsers = rdd.mapPartitions(ids => {
  ids.map(id => ScalaKryoInstantiator.defaultPool.fromBytes(id).asInstanceOf[TopCMS[String]])
}).reduce(_ ++ _)

  
val globalTopK = approxUsers.heavyHitters.map(id =>
          (id, approxUsers.frequency(id).estimate)).toSeq.sortBy(_._2).reverse.slice(0, TOPK)

z.show(globalTopK.toDF("User Name", "Number of Tweets"))
